alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 1:31PM CDT until March 31 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM CDT FOR HANCOCK COUNTY... At 131 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Elvaston, or 7 miles southeast of Keokuk, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Elvaston around 135 PM CDT. Carthage and Ferris around 140 PM CDT. Adrian, Burnside and Colusa around 145 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Dallas City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois...and southeastern Iowa.
